mediaNotes: NOTES: A variety of calls by a pair of birds foraging around the small clearing along the stream a short distance before the sharp bend in the road at the bottom of the hill; they regularly perched up on stalks about 30 cm up, but they regularly dropped to the ground, and at the end of the recording they flew down to the edge of the clearing and then down along stream where they foraged quietly; these birds typically called only when they flew, making them difficult to record; in this cut they ranged from 4 to 25 meters from me; they regularly sat up and dipped their tails; almost fully overcast, trace breeze, probably in the mid- to upper 80s (though the thermometer read 89-90¬° F). Other Behaviors: Mate. Habitat: Rainforest, Evergreen Forest, Creek.

NOTES: A pair well seen 25-30 meters away and 1/2 to 1 1/2 meters over the water in dense scrubby bushes and fallen wood along the shore of the upper arm of the new reservoir; typically one bird would fly and the other would join it and they would duet and display (bobbing up-and-down waving their wings) when they joined each other; they were moving quite a lot; high clouds, trace breeze, mid-80s. Response to playback: Approach. Response to playback: Normal song. Other Behaviors: Advertise, Mate, Social Context: Family. Habitat: Rainforest, Evergreen Forest, Lake, Scrub, Edge.
A pair in response to playback, 5m away from microphone. Also on tape: Taraba major, Tyrannulus elatus.
11:35 hrs. By the shrimp pools

NOTES: Unseen was about 60 meters away and high up at the edge of relatively good forest with a 20-25 meter-tall canopy along the arm of the new reservoir about 200-300 meters below the upper end where I took the GPS reading (presumably one of the same birds recorded the previous day in cut #2001-30-03; the bird gave a long-call at 5:12:07; 48 seconds cut out between call and announcement; two or three birds were calling; I heard one song at 5:49:52, which was the only song I heard this morning; full moon 10¬° up in western sky at 5:25; clear, calm, 73-74¬° F. Other Behaviors: Beg, Social Context: Family. Habitat: Rainforest, Evergreen Forest, Lake, Scrub, Edge.
Juvenile begging calls to two attendant adults. Juvenile is doing all the calling.
Bright call notes from bird along edge of large wetland pond at dawn.
Also on tape: Tyrannulus elatus.
A compact pair. Both male & female moved together, in response to playback. Also on tape: Legatus leucophaius, Ramphocelus flammigerus icteronotus, Myiozetetes cayanensis.
Recordist's Notes: duet. ID certainty 100%.

mediaNotes: Recordist's Notes: ID certainty 100%.

typical calls of a bird on the ground. Elevation: 140 m. Date added to IBC: June 22, 2016.
Also on tape: Tyrannulus elatus, Legatus leucophaius, Taraba major, Tyrannus melancholicus.
ML: Identified by the recordist as Fluvicola nengeta atripennis following the IOC World Bird List. Recordist's Notes: Calls. Seen. 2 birds. Edge of marsh. Elevation: 18 m.

NOTES: A series of recordings of three birds that I saw as they foraged 12-30 meters away on the surface of a dirt road through fields of sugar cane but with forest fragments at the edges of the field; the birds seemed to be going after prey attracted to cane stubble that had been dropped in the road; they typically called only in flight or just before they took flight (flying 3-4 meters over the ground) so I had to walk up on them and try to get something on tape before they went quiet; possibly a family group, I noticed that these birds were often seen in groups of two to four birds; weather conditions similar [mostly low overcast, calm, 74¬° F] but clearing up more. Other Behaviors: Establish Flock Contact. Habitat: Rural, Field, Scrub, Edge.
At the wetlands near the volunteer grounds.

location.locality: town plaza with bus station. Quebra. Lagoa Santa. 2km N, across from man-made pond.

mediaNotes: Habitat: Subtropical; Central Plateau; end of wet season; cerrado, marsh next to orchard. Air Temp = 29C. ?song. Sung when male and female meet at nest. Strata in habitat: on branches hanging low over marsh water. Equipment Notes: Microphone: Uher M538.
in the parking lot of the hotel, a pair calling and feeding young, built a nest on power pole not far off the ground.  Both male and female bring insects to the nest.
NOTES: Breeding status: paired. Number of individuals=AU1-2;. Other Behaviors: Advertise. Habitat: Pond, Pasture, Scrub.

General climate: mostly dry, but now rainy season. Environmental zone: tropical. Season: wet. Habitat: rural yard, orchard, cultivated. Water association: pond. Air Temp: 26¬∞C. On wire fence over water.   Notes: Triangular bird - little blk + white - fishing in water. Sat in fence area over water with lavandeira's - made clacking noise - a mechanical sound produced by tail (?) jerking - no other call. would produce sound upon arrival after short flight. tail flicks slightly. Other Behaviors: Establish Flock Contact, Contact, Flight Sound. Equipment Notes: Microphone: Uher M538. Field tape: Scotch.  Microphone: Sony.

location.locality: Santa Teresa; Museu Biol. Prof. Mello Leitao

mediaNotes: NOTES:  Cover density: OPEN; OPEN PARK, WITH TREES AND SHRUBS, ADJOINING A STREAM. DISPLAY - PROBABLY ADVERTISING. BIRD WAS PERCHED ABOUT 2 METERS FROM GROUND ON YOUNG TREE. WHILE SINGING THE BIRD RAPIDLY FLICKED WINGS AND TAIL. THE WING FLICKING WAS A HORIZONTAL EXTENSION AND RE-FOLDING - SEVERAL TIMES SUCCESSIVELY. TAIL FLICKING WAS HORIZONTAL SPREADING AND RE-FOLDING - SEVERAL TIMES SUCCESSIVELY.. Other Behaviors: Perform Visual Display. Habitat: Creek.
